data.title: Leadership Team
data.meta_description: At Moorfield, relationships are key to us and that includes our own talent pool who we incentivise and nurture. Meet our leadership team.
data.text:
Marc is the Executive Chair and co-Chief Executive Officer of Moorfield Group where he Chairs the Group Board together with the Strategy, Investment, Remuneration and Audit & Risk Committees. Marc assumed management control of Moorfield Group in 1996 and immediately founded the Company’s private equity real estate strategy. He subsequently led Moorfield’s transformation from a small company listed on the London Stock Exchange into one of the leading UK Private Equity Real Estate fund managers. Over the last 28 years Moorfield has invested throughout the UK in both the Traditional and Alternative real estate sectors, translating political, economic and societal macro trends into real estate investment themes. Moorfield has been at the vanguard of many of the alternative real estate sectors in the UK.

Marc is a Chartered Surveyor and initially specialised in investment and development finance and then became a top-rated real estate equity analyst and advisor prior to becoming a private equity investor. Marc has worked for leading surveying firms and investment banks including Gerald Eve (Newmark), Edward Erdman (Colliers), UBS, NatWest Markets and Goldman Sachs. In October 2011, the Howard de Walden Estate appointed Marc to its Board as a Non-Executive Director and he now Chairs the Investment Committee and serves on the Audit Committee. In April 2016, Marc became Chair of Audley Group, the retirement village developer and operator, Chair of the Investment and Remuneration Committees and serves as a member of the Audit & Risk Committee. Marc is a Member of the Leaders Council of the British Property Federation (BPF), a Member of the Property Advisory Group to the Bank of England, a Member of the Investment Property Forum (IPF) and a Member of the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (RICS) where he also serves on the Investment Property Forum. Marc sits on the Editorial Board of the Academy of Real Assets, is a Patron of Land Aid and a signatory to the CEO Commitments of Real Estate Balance.

Charlie joined Moorfield in 2005 and as co-CEO is responsible for running the business alongside Marc. Charlie has been on the Moorfield Group Board since 2011, became CIO in 2013 and is on the Investment and Remuneration Committees and chairs the Operational Board. As Chief Investment Officer Charlie is responsible for overseeing investment strategy and portfolio construction and carries out a leading fundraising role.

Since 2005, Moorfield has raised six discretionary funds and established a series of co-investment vehicles and joint ventures, including a private REIT. Over the period Moorfield has increasingly focused on the living and storage sectors, delivering strong returns for investors.

Charlie has a degree in Modern Languages from Oxford University and prior to joining Moorfield he worked in corporate finance at Lazard in the real estate advisory group. Whilst at Lazard he was part of a market leading team that advised a number of listed property companies on M&A transactions and private equity groups investing in asset-backed transactions.

Charlie has advised on a number of industry committees, including the BPF Commercial Property Forum, the BPF Build to Rent group, the IPF Indirect Property Funds Group, and the Mayor of London’s Homes for Londoners Board on New Delivery Models. Charlie is also a non-executive director on the Audley Group Board and on the Investment, Remuneration and Audit & Risk Committees.

Jane is a Managing Director of Canary Wharf Group with overall executive responsibility for People, Customer Experience and Social Value. Prior to joining Canary Wharf Group in 2021, Jane ran her own strategic consultancy business, advising British Land plc, the British Property Federation, Knight Frank and Savills.

She was formerly a Non-Executive Director of Notting Hill Genesis Housing Association, Chair of its Operations Committee and a Member of its Nominations Committee and Remuneration Committee. Jane was also a Board member of Pathways to Property, an initiative focussed on increasing social mobility within the real estate industry, led by RREF, Henley Business School and supported by the Sutton Trust.

Jane is a qualified solicitor and prior to founding her consultancy business, had a twenty-year career in the City as an Equity Partner and Real Estate Sector Head at Addleshaw Goddard, where she was also a Member of its UK Governance Board. She graduated with a degree in Law from the London School of Economics.

Steve joined Moorfield in 2008 and sits on the Main and Operational Boards as CFO and is Compliance Officer and MLRO of our FCA-regulated investment manager. He oversees all financial aspects and regulatory requirements of the group. He is responsible for overseeing the structuring of acquisitions and our real estate funds and sits on the board of a number of the companies within the Moorfield Real Estate Funds.

Steve has a degree in Biology from University College London and is a Chartered Accountant. He joined Moorfield from Grant Thornton where he was a senior manager specialising in audit and transaction support for a range of businesses.

Chris joined Moorfield in 2013 and is Head of Origination. Chris leads the Origination Team, focusing on the sourcing, analysis and execution of new investment opportunities. Chris has a great deal of experience across many asset types and has led the origination of Moorfield’s activities in logistics, open storage, self storage and healthcare in recent years and has had an active involvement across all sectors that Moorfield has invested in.

Chris is a Chartered Surveyor and holds an MPhil in Real Estate Finance from Cambridge University. He joined Moorfield from LaSalle Investment Management where he worked in the Debt and Special Situations team. Before this he worked across three La Salle managed UK pension funds and previously with the M&A team at Jones Lang LaSalle Corporate Finance.

Heiko joined Moorfield in 2013 and is Head of Operational Asset Management. As such, he is principally responsible for overseeing the operational aspects of our investments, particularly those in the Hospitality, Build To Rent and Student Accommodation sectors. Heiko has brought Moorfield over 25 years of experience in the hospitality industry, having previously managed Guoman & Thistle Hotels as Managing Director, Paramount Hotels as Chief Operating Officer and Marriott Hotels as Operations Director for their regional hotel estate. Heiko now focusses on applying the skills and expertise he learnt in the hospitality industry to our operational assets.

Heiko was educated and trained in Bonn, Germany and is fluent in German and English. He is a Fellow of the Institute of Hospitality and has advised as a Board Director of the British Hospitality Association and as a Board Director of Springboard UK, a charity that promotes employment opportunities for young and disadvantaged people in the hospitality industry.

Andrew is a Chartered Certified Accountant with a first-class honours degree in Business and Management. Andrew joined Moorfield in 2012 and is a Senior Finance Manager with responsibility for the financial management of a number of fund and group investments, including all Build to Rent and Student investments.

Prior to joining Moorfield, Andrew spent four years working for Residential Land, a specialist prime central London property consultant where he was responsible for the financial reporting of a number of HNW property portfolios. Before that Andrew worked for Places for People where he was Regional Finance Officer for London and reported on a portfolio of over 10,000 rented homes.

Ian is the Executive Partner for UK, US and EMEA and became a member of the firm’s Global Executive Board in 2012.

Based in London Ian has extensive experience of commercial property and helps clients with all aspects of UK real estate with an emphasis on private equity investment, property finance and structured finance, including establishing alternative vehicles for property investment.

Ian regularly advises overseas investors entering the UK market. His expertise is sought by clients in industries as diverse as financial services and leisure and sport. His expertise in commercial property is highlighted by his recommendation in Chambers UK.
